name: Ext.grid.selection.SpreadsheetModel
doc:
A selection model for grids which allows you to select data in a spreadsheet-like manner.

Supported features:

  • Single / Range / Multiple individual row selection.
  • Single / Range cell selection.
  • Column selection by click selecting column headers.
  • Select / deselect all by clicking in the top-left, header.
  • Adds row number column to enable row selection.
  • Optionally you can enable row selection using checkboxes

Example usage

var store = Ext.create('Ext.data.Store', {
    fields: ['name', 'email', 'phone'],
    data: [
        { name: 'Lisa', email: 'lisa@simpsons.com', phone: '555-111-1224' },
        { name: 'Bart', email: 'bart@simpsons.com', phone: '555-222-1234' },
        { name: 'Homer', email: 'homer@simpsons.com', phone: '555-222-1244' },
        { name: 'Marge', email: 'marge@simpsons.com', phone: '555-222-1254' }
    ]
});

Ext.create('Ext.grid.Panel', {
    title: 'Simpsons',
    store: store,
    width: 400,
    renderTo: Ext.getBody(),
    columns: [
        { text: 'Name', dataIndex: 'name' },
        { text: 'Email', dataIndex: 'email', flex: 1 },
        { text: 'Phone', dataIndex: 'phone' }
    ],
    selModel: {
       type: 'spreadsheet'
    }
});

members.name: allowDeselect
members.doc: Allow users to deselect a record in a DataView, List or Grid. Only applicable when the mode is 'SINGLE'.
members.short_doc: Allow users to deselect a record in a DataView, List or Grid. ...

members.name: cellSelect
members.doc: Set to true to enable selection of individual cells or a single rectangular range of cells. This will provide cell range selection using click, and potentially drag to select a rectangular range. You can also use "SHIFT + arrow" key navigation to select a range of cells.
members.short_doc:
Set to true to enable selection of individual cells or a single rectangular
range of cells. ...

members.name: checkboxColumnIndex
members.doc: The index at which to insert the checkbox column. Supported values are a numeric index, and the strings 'first' and 'last'. Only valid when set before render.
members.short_doc: The index at which to insert the checkbox column. ...

members.name: checkboxHeaderWidth
members.short_doc: Width of checkbox column. ...

members.name: checkboxSelect
members.doc: [checkboxSelect=false] Enables selection of the row via clicking on checkbox. Note: this feature will add new column at position specified by checkboxColumnIndex.
members.short_doc:
[checkboxSelect=false]
Enables selection of the row via clicking on checkbox. ...

members.name: columnSelect
members.doc:
Set to true to enable selection of columns.

NOTE: This will remove sorting on header click and instead provide column selection and deselection. Sorting is still available via column header menu.
members.short_doc: Set to true to enable selection of columns. ...

members.name: dragSelect
members.doc: Set to true to enables cell range selection by cell dragging.
members.short_doc: Set to true to enables cell range selection by cell dragging. ...

members.name: ignoreRightMouseSelection
members.doc: True to ignore selections that are made when using the right mouse button if there are records that are already selected. If no records are selected, selection will continue as normal
members.short_doc:
True to ignore selections that are made when using the right mouse button if there are
records that are already selec...

members.name: mode
members.doc:
Mode of selection. Valid values are:

  • "SINGLE" - Only allows selecting one item at a time. Use allowDeselect to allow deselecting that item. Also see toggleOnClick. This is the default.
  • "SIMPLE" - Allows simple selection of multiple items one-by-one. Each click in grid will either select or deselect an item.
  • "MULTI" - Allows complex selection of multiple items using Ctrl and Shift keys.
members.short_doc: Mode of selection. ...

members.name: pruneRemoved
members.doc:
Remove records from the selection when they are removed from the store.

Important: When using paging or a Ext.data.BufferedStore, records which are cached in the Store's data collection may be removed from the Store when pages change, or when rows are scrolled out of view. For this reason pruneRemoved should be set to false when using a buffered Store.

Also, when previously pruned pages are returned to the cache, the records objects in the page will be new instances, and will not match the instances in the selection model's collection. For this reason, you MUST ensure that the Model definition's idProperty references a unique key because in this situation, records in the Store have their IDs compared to records in the SelectionModel in order to re-select a record which is scrolled back into view.
members.short_doc: Remove records from the selection when they are removed from the store. ...

members.name: rowNumbererHeaderWidth
members.short_doc: Width of row numbering column. ...

members.name: rowSelect
members.doc:
Set to true to enable selection of rows by clicking on a row number column.

Note: This feature will add the row number as the first column.
members.short_doc: Set to true to enable selection of rows by clicking on a row number column. ...

members.name: selected
members.doc: Pass an instance of one of the subclasses of Ext.grid.selection.Selection.

members.name: showHeaderCheckbox

when checkboxSelect is set. ...

members.name: getCellContext
members.doc:
This is a helper method to create a cell context which encapsulates one cell in a grid view.

It will contain the following properties: colIdx - column index rowIdx - row index column - Column under which the cell is located. record - Ext.data.Model Record from which the cell derives its data. view - The view. If this selection model is for a locking grid, this will be the outermost view, the Ext.grid.locking.View which encapsulates the sub grids. Column indices are relative to the outermost view's visible column set.

params.name: record
params.doc: Record for which to select the cell, or row index.

return.name: return
return.doc: A context object describing the cell. Note that the rowidx and colIdx properties are only valid at the time the context object is created. Column movement, sorting or filtering might changed where the cell is.

members.short_doc: This is a helper method to create a cell context which encapsulates one cell in a grid view. ...

The three selection types are:

members.name: pruneRemovedOnRefresh
members.doc: onStoreRefresh asks if it should remove from the selection any selected records which are no longer findable in the store after the refresh. Subclasses may override this. TreeModel does not use the pruneRemoved flag because records are being added and removed from TreeStores on expand and collapse. It uses the pruneRemovedNodes flag.

onStoreRefresh asks if it should remove from the selection any selected records which are no
longer findable in the s...

members.name: select
members.doc: Selects a record instance by record instance or index.
members.short_doc: Selects a record instance by record instance or index. ...

members.name: selectAll
members.doc:
Select all the data if possible.

If rowSelect is true, then all records will be selected.

If cellSelect is true, then all rendered cells will be selected.

If columnSelect is true, then all columns will be selected.
members.short_doc: Select all the data if possible. ...

members.name: selectCells
members.doc:
This method allows programmatic selection of the cell range.

var store = Ext.create('Ext.data.Store', {
    fields  : ['name', 'email', 'phone'],
    data    : {
        items : [
            { name : 'Lisa',  email : 'lisa@simpsons.com',  phone : '555-111-1224' },
            { name : 'Bart',  email : 'bart@simpsons.com',  phone : '555-222-1234' },
            { name : 'Homer', email : 'homer@simpsons.com', phone : '555-222-1244' },
            { name : 'Marge', email : 'marge@simpsons.com', phone : '555-222-1254' }
        ]
    },
    proxy   : {
        type   : 'memory',
        reader : {
            type : 'json',
            root : 'items'
        }
    }
});

var grid = Ext.create('Ext.grid.Panel', {
    title    : 'Simpsons',
    store    : store,
    width    : 400,
    renderTo : Ext.getBody(),
    columns  : [
       columns: [
          { text: 'Name',  dataIndex: 'name' },
          { text: 'Email', dataIndex: 'email', flex: 1 },
          { text: 'Phone', dataIndex: 'phone', width:120 },
          {
              text:'Combined', dataIndex: 'name', width : 300,
              renderer: function(value, metaData, record, rowIndex, colIndex, store, view) {
                  console.log(arguments);
                  return value + ' has email: ' + record.get('email');
              }
          }
      ],
    ],
    selType: 'spreadsheet'
});

var model = grid.getSelectionModel();  // get selection model

// We will create range of 4 cells.

// Now set the range  and prevent rangeselect event from being fired.
// We can use a simple array when we have no locked columns.
model.selectCells([0, 0], [1, 1], true);

params.name: rangeStart
params.doc:
{Ext.grid.CellContext/Number[]} Range starting position. Can be either Cell context or a [rowIndex, columnIndex] numeric array.

Note that when a numeric array is used in a locking grid, the column indices are relative to the outermost grid, encompassing locked and normal sides.

params.name: rangeEnd
params.doc:
{Ext.grid.CellContext/Number[]} Range end position. Can be either Cell context or a [rowIndex, columnIndex] numeric array.

Note that when a numeric array is used in a locking grid, the column indices are relative to the outermost grid, encompassing locked and normal sides.

members.short_doc: This method allows programmatic selection of the cell range. ...

params.name: endRow
params.doc: The record or index of the last row in the range

members.name: updateSelectedInstances
members.doc:
Called when the store is refreshed. Selected records which are no longer present in the store are removed if pruneRemoved is true.

Selected records which are still present have their instances in the passed collection updated.

params.name: selected
params.doc: A Collection representing the currently selected records.
